div.div:
Initial Editing:
Google docs is efficient for collaborative, private editing. You could use some other editor, of course.
It's up to the WG to decide when you are done, your process for review, etc.
Chrome has has an add-on for markdown export (after install, find it at Add-ons > Docs > markdown)

div.div: Decide which "BP Section" this doc will go into.

div.div:
There are currently 3 sections:
EML Metadata
Scientific Domains
Non-tabular data and other packaging challenges

div.div:
TBD:
what exactly should this process look like? Possibly, contributors (working group) would use a fork and PR that the repo owners (BP editors) would merge in.
Same process could be used for existing pages, but it starts within the git repo (no new page needed)
